results.name: a(n) is the starting position of the first occurrence of a string of at least n 3's in the decimal expansion of Pi.
comment: Differs from A096757 which lists occurrences of strings of exactly n '3's. - _M. F. Hasler_, Mar 17 2017
link: Peter Trüb, 22.4 trillion digits of pi
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Pi Digits.
